BTCUSD.title: Defiance Files for 49 Proposed 3x Leveraged ETFs That Could Include Bitcoin-Focused Funds
BTCUSD.body: Defiance Investments filed a prospectus proposing 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs, including crypto-focused funds that track Coinbase, MicroStrategy, Robinhood, BitMine Immersion, Circle, Grayscale mini-trusts and a Solana ETF; the filing warns these 3X leveraged ETFs carry high short-term risk for aggressive traders. 49 proposed funds offering 3X long and inverse exposure Proposals include crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs, tech stocks and gold with explicit investor risk warnings. Spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF demand helped spur filings; BTC ETFs hold roughly $150 billion in assets (CoinGlass data). 3X leveraged ETFs by Defiance Investments propose triple-long and inverse crypto and tech exposure; read the filing highlights and risk considerations ‚Äî learn more now. What are Defiance Investments‚Äô proposed 3X leveraged ETFs? Defiance Investments‚Äô prospectus requests 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs , offering triple daily exposure to crypto firms, token-linked ETFs and select tech names. The filing lists single-stock, ETF and crypto ETP targets and repeatedly warns these funds are suited only for aggressive, short-term traders. How do the proposed 3X leveraged crypto ETFs differ from existing 2X products? Three-times leveraged ETFs aim to deliver approximately 3X the daily return of an underlying asset, versus 2X funds that seek double daily moves. Because leverage compounds daily, 3X funds amplify volatility and path dependency, increasing the chance of significant losses over multi-day holding periods. Regulators and market analysts have expressed caution. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "headline": "Defiance files for 49 3X leveraged ETFs, including crypto and tech exposures", "datePublished": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "dateModified": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "author": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG" }, "publisher": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG", "logo": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://en.coinotag.com/logo.png" } }, "description": "Defiance Investments proposed 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs covering crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs and tech names, with explicit risk disclosures for short-term traders.", "mainEntityOfPage": { "@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://en.coinotag.com/articles/defiance-49-3x-etfs-prospectus" }} Why did Defiance target crypto firms and token ETFs with 3X leverage? Defiance targeted crypto firms and token-linked ETFs to meet rising investor demand for direct and derivative exposure to digital assets. The surge in spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF inflows ‚Äî with Bitcoin-related funds commanding sizable assets according to CoinGlass ‚Äî encouraged issuers to explore leveraged versions despite higher risk. What specific companies and token ETFs are named in the filing? The prospectus lists funds tied to Coinbase, MicroStrategy (Bitcoin treasury exposure), Robinhood, BitMine Immersion (Ethereum treasury exposure), Circle (USDC issuer), Grayscale mini-trust ETFs tracking Bitcoin and Ethereum, and a Solana ETF from Volatility Shares. The filing proposes both 3X long and 3X inverse share classes for many of these exposures. Recent filings ‚Äî including Defiance‚Äôs ‚Äî indicate the SEC is receiving applications for higher-leverage products. Market analysts, such as ETF.com senior analyst Sumit Roy, note the regulator may permit more volatile products, but approvals will depend on disclosures, structure and investor-protection considerations. How should investors evaluate proposed 3X leveraged ETFs? Evaluate leverage objectives, daily rebalancing mechanics, expense ratios, underlying liquidity, and prospectus risk disclosures. Compare historical one-day return replication and understand compounding effects for multi-day holdings. These funds are primarily for experienced, short-term traders. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "HowTo", "name": "How to evaluate a 3X leveraged ETF", "description": "Steps to assess whether a 3X leveraged ETF aligns with a trader's objectives and risk tolerance.", "step": [ { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Read the prospectus", "text": "Review leverage goal, daily reset rules, and risk warnings contained in the fund's prospectus." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Analyze volatility and liquidity", "text": "Check historical intraday and daily volatility of the underlying asset and the ETF's trading volume." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Simulate multi-day scenarios", "text": "Model multi-day returns to understand compounding effects and potential drawdowns for holding periods beyond one day." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Compare costs", "text": "Compare expense ratios and transaction costs relative to alternative exposure methods." } ]} Key Takeaways Defiance filed for 49 3X ETFs : Proposals include crypto firms, token ETFs and tech stocks, with both long and inverse classes. Higher leverage increases risk : 3X daily leverage amplifies volatility and can produce large multi-day divergences from expected returns. BTCUSD.title: VanEck Says Lower Volatility May Explain September Network Revenue Drops as Tron Remains Top Earner
BTCUSD.body: Blockchain network revenue fell 16% month-over-month in September as reduced crypto volatility lowered demand for high-priority transactions, driving network fees down across major chains such as Ethereum, Solana and Tron. Network revenue fell 16% MoM in September Ethereum fees down 6%, Solana down 11%, Tron fees dropped 37% after a governance fee cut. Volatility fell sharply: ETH -40%, SOL -16%, BTC -26% ‚Äî reducing arbitrage-driven fee demand. Blockchain network revenue fell 16% in September due to lower crypto volatility; read the full analysis, data, and investor takeaways. Learn how fees and fundamentals changed. Asset manager VanEck attributed the broad decline in blockchain network revenue in September to lower volatility in the crypto markets. What caused the decline in blockchain network revenue in September? Blockchain network revenue declined 16% month-over-month in September primarily because lower crypto volatility reduced traders‚Äô need to pay priority fees, decreasing total fees across major networks. VanEck‚Äôs analysis cites reduced arbitrage and fewer high-priority transactions as the main drivers. VanEck reported that overall network revenues across the blockchain ecosystem dropped by 16% month-over-month in September, linked to diminished volatility and lower transaction fee demand. Ethereum network revenue fell by 6% and Solana‚Äôs by 11%. The Tron network recorded a 37% reduction in fees, which VanEck attributes to a governance proposal that halved gas fees in August. Most cryptocurrencies experienced reduced volatility in September. Source: VanEck How did volatility changes affect crypto network fees? Reduced volatility curtailed arbitrage and time-sensitive trading that typically pushes users to pay higher fees for faster settlement. Ether (ETH) volatility dropped about 40% in September, SOL volatility fell 16%, and BTC volatility declined 26%, according to VanEck‚Äôs figures. Lower volatility means fewer rapid price moves and thus fewer priority transactions, translating directly into lower network revenue and smaller fee pools for validators and miners. Why did Tron lead revenue metrics despite lower fees? Tron remains the top revenue-generating crypto ecosystem, producing roughly $3.6 billion over the last year, according to Token Terminal data cited in market reporting. This leadership stems largely from stablecoin activity ‚Äî 51% of circulating Tether USDt supply is issued on the Tron network. A comparison of crypto network fees over the last year. Source: Token Terminal By comparison, Ethereum generated about $1 billion in annual revenue despite ETH reaching all-time highs in August and a market capitalization near $539 billion ‚Äî roughly 16x TRX‚Äôs market cap of about $32 billion. Stablecoins continue to expand: the stablecoin market cap crossed $292 billion in October 2025, per RWA.XYZ data, reinforcing Tron‚Äôs role in settlement and recurring fee generation. How should investors interpret network revenue and fees? Network revenues and fees are a core metric for assessing blockchain economic activity and protocol health. Monitor fees as a short-term gauge of transaction demand and revenue as a longer-term indicator of platform monetization and product fit. Analysts track fundamentals such as active addresses, transaction value, and fee revenue to evaluate project trajectories and ecosystem resilience. Frequently Asked Questions How large was the month-over-month revenue decline in September? The blockchain ecosystem saw a 16% month-over-month decline in network revenue in September, driven largely by reduced volatility and lower priority-fee transactions. Did any networks buck the trend in September? Tron continued to lead annual revenue generation despite a 37% monthly fee drop, thanks to heavy stablecoin settlement activity and prior fee-structure changes. What role did governance changes play in fee reductions? On Tron, a governance proposal reduced gas fees by over 50% in August, contributing to a 37% drop in network fees in September as reflected in revenue data. { "@context": "https://schema.org", Investors should combine fee analytics with on-chain activity and stablecoin trends to evaluate ecosystem health. Review network fundamentals regularly to inform allocation and risk decisions.

BTCUSD.title: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron
BTCUSD.body: Asset management giant VanEck has published its cryptocurrency market report for September 2025. The report noted that Digital Asset Treasuries (DAT) holdings have reached approximately $135 billion, with institutional investors, in particular, continuing to accumulate and stake ETH. VanEck noted that this creates a dilution risk for investors outside of staking. The report also touched on Ethereum's upcoming Fusaka upgrade in December. This update is expected to reduce Layer-2 rollup costs by increasing blob capacity and improve network efficiency by allowing nodes to perform block validation using probabilistic sampling. According to VanEck's report, 23 of the 35 major tokens closed the month lower. Bitcoin (BTC) rose 5%, while Ethereum (ETH) fell 5%. The overall decline in market volatility has dampened both price action and blockchain revenue, causing stagnation in the sector. According to the report, blockchain revenues fell by 16% month-over-month: Ethereum revenues: -6% Solana revenues: -11% Tron revenues: -37% VanEck stated that the primary reason for this decline was the decrease in market volatility. In September, volatility fell by -40% for ETH, -26% for BTC, and -16% for SOL. While decentralized spot exchange (DEX) volumes remained at August levels of approximately $365 billion, futures volumes increased by 30%. Much of this increase was driven by the token launch of the Aster platform within the Binance ecosystem and incentivized trading pairs. Related News: Claims Spread That XRP Spot ETF Was Automatically Approved: How True Is It? Top performing tokens in September: Mantle (MNT): +53% Avalanche (AVAX): +24% Binance Coin (BNB): +16% The weakest performers are: Polygon (POL): -19% Arbitrum (ARB): -17% Toncoin (TON): -14% VanEck noted that since 2016, September has generally been marked by negative returns. On average, Bitcoin loses 3% of its value in September, while Ethereum loses 7%. The year 2025 is no exception to this historical trend. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron

Conclusion The Defiance prospectus signals a push to expand 3X leveraged ETFs across crypto and tech exposures, reflecting issuer interest in meeting aggressive trader demand. 3X leveraged ETFs may arrive if approved, but their complexity and high risk make careful evaluation essential. Monitor regulatory decisions and read fund disclosures before trading. NEW: @Defiance_ETFs has just filed for just shy of 50 3X levered ETFs. ETHUSD.title: VanEck Says Lower Volatility May Explain September Network Revenue Drops as Tron Remains Top Earner
ETHUSD.body: Blockchain network revenue fell 16% month-over-month in September as reduced crypto volatility lowered demand for high-priority transactions, driving network fees down across major chains such as Ethereum, Solana and Tron. Network revenue fell 16% MoM in September Ethereum fees down 6%, Solana down 11%, Tron fees dropped 37% after a governance fee cut. Volatility fell sharply: ETH -40%, SOL -16%, BTC -26% ‚Äî reducing arbitrage-driven fee demand. Blockchain network revenue fell 16% in September due to lower crypto volatility; read the full analysis, data, and investor takeaways. Learn how fees and fundamentals changed. Asset manager VanEck attributed the broad decline in blockchain network revenue in September to lower volatility in the crypto markets. What caused the decline in blockchain network revenue in September? Blockchain network revenue declined 16% month-over-month in September primarily because lower crypto volatility reduced traders‚Äô need to pay priority fees, decreasing total fees across major networks. VanEck‚Äôs analysis cites reduced arbitrage and fewer high-priority transactions as the main drivers. VanEck reported that overall network revenues across the blockchain ecosystem dropped by 16% month-over-month in September, linked to diminished volatility and lower transaction fee demand. Ethereum network revenue fell by 6% and Solana‚Äôs by 11%. The Tron network recorded a 37% reduction in fees, which VanEck attributes to a governance proposal that halved gas fees in August. Most cryptocurrencies experienced reduced volatility in September. Source: VanEck How did volatility changes affect crypto network fees? Reduced volatility curtailed arbitrage and time-sensitive trading that typically pushes users to pay higher fees for faster settlement. Ether (ETH) volatility dropped about 40% in September, SOL volatility fell 16%, and BTC volatility declined 26%, according to VanEck‚Äôs figures. Lower volatility means fewer rapid price moves and thus fewer priority transactions, translating directly into lower network revenue and smaller fee pools for validators and miners. Why did Tron lead revenue metrics despite lower fees? Tron remains the top revenue-generating crypto ecosystem, producing roughly $3.6 billion over the last year, according to Token Terminal data cited in market reporting. This leadership stems largely from stablecoin activity ‚Äî 51% of circulating Tether USDt supply is issued on the Tron network. A comparison of crypto network fees over the last year. Source: Token Terminal By comparison, Ethereum generated about $1 billion in annual revenue despite ETH reaching all-time highs in August and a market capitalization near $539 billion ‚Äî roughly 16x TRX‚Äôs market cap of about $32 billion. Stablecoins continue to expand: the stablecoin market cap crossed $292 billion in October 2025, per RWA.XYZ data, reinforcing Tron‚Äôs role in settlement and recurring fee generation. How should investors interpret network revenue and fees? Network revenues and fees are a core metric for assessing blockchain economic activity and protocol health. Monitor fees as a short-term gauge of transaction demand and revenue as a longer-term indicator of platform monetization and product fit. Analysts track fundamentals such as active addresses, transaction value, and fee revenue to evaluate project trajectories and ecosystem resilience. Frequently Asked Questions How large was the month-over-month revenue decline in September? The blockchain ecosystem saw a 16% month-over-month decline in network revenue in September, driven largely by reduced volatility and lower priority-fee transactions. Did any networks buck the trend in September? Tron continued to lead annual revenue generation despite a 37% monthly fee drop, thanks to heavy stablecoin settlement activity and prior fee-structure changes. What role did governance changes play in fee reductions? On Tron, a governance proposal reduced gas fees by over 50% in August, contributing to a 37% drop in network fees in September as reflected in revenue data. { "@context": "https://schema.org", ETHUSD.title: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron
ETHUSD.body: Asset management giant VanEck has published its cryptocurrency market report for September 2025. The report noted that Digital Asset Treasuries (DAT) holdings have reached approximately $135 billion, with institutional investors, in particular, continuing to accumulate and stake ETH. VanEck noted that this creates a dilution risk for investors outside of staking. The report also touched on Ethereum's upcoming Fusaka upgrade in December. This update is expected to reduce Layer-2 rollup costs by increasing blob capacity and improve network efficiency by allowing nodes to perform block validation using probabilistic sampling. According to VanEck's report, 23 of the 35 major tokens closed the month lower. Bitcoin (BTC) rose 5%, while Ethereum (ETH) fell 5%. The overall decline in market volatility has dampened both price action and blockchain revenue, causing stagnation in the sector. According to the report, blockchain revenues fell by 16% month-over-month: Ethereum revenues: -6% Solana revenues: -11% Tron revenues: -37% VanEck stated that the primary reason for this decline was the decrease in market volatility. In September, volatility fell by -40% for ETH, -26% for BTC, and -16% for SOL. While decentralized spot exchange (DEX) volumes remained at August levels of approximately $365 billion, futures volumes increased by 30%. Much of this increase was driven by the token launch of the Aster platform within the Binance ecosystem and incentivized trading pairs. Related News: Claims Spread That XRP Spot ETF Was Automatically Approved: How True Is It? Top performing tokens in September: Mantle (MNT): +53% Avalanche (AVAX): +24% Binance Coin (BNB): +16% The weakest performers are: Polygon (POL): -19% Arbitrum (ARB): -17% Toncoin (TON): -14% VanEck noted that since 2016, September has generally been marked by negative returns. On average, Bitcoin loses 3% of its value in September, while Ethereum loses 7%. The year 2025 is no exception to this historical trend. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron

ADAUSD.title: SEC May Review REX-Osprey Staking ETFs Offering Solana Yield and Price Exposure Amid Shutdown Delays
ADAUSD.body: REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are exchange-traded funds that combine price exposure with staking rewards, allowing investors to earn yield on tokens such as ADA, AVAX and NEAR while tracking market performance. The SEC is reviewing 21 such ETF filings amid government shutdown delays. SEC review of 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs underway Funds propose staking exposure to altcoins including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SUI and others. Up to 40% of assets may be allocated to non-U.S. crypto ETPs from issuers like 21Shares and CoinShares. Meta description: staking crypto ETFs under SEC review ‚Äî 21 REX-Osprey filings offer yield plus price exposure to ADA, AVAX, NEAR; follow regulatory updates on en.coinotag.com. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs offering yield and price exposure to altcoins like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR amid shutdown delays. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs as shutdown delays approval and review timelines. New ETFs include staked tokens like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR, offering both yield and price exposure. Up to 40% of ETF assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto ETPs from 21Shares, CoinShares, and Valour. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is reviewing multiple staking-based crypto ETF filings while operating with reduced staff during a government shutdown. REX Shares and Osprey Funds have proposed 21 spot ETFs that combine staking rewards with token price exposure, broadening regulated access to altcoins for institutional and retail investors. What are the REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs under SEC review? REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are proposed funds that would hold and stake selected proof-of-stake tokens, paying staking rewards to the ETF while tracking token price movements. The filings name tokens such as ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI and SUI and outline use of Cayman subsidiaries to meet regulatory and tax requirements. How do these ETFs combine yield and price exposure? The funds are structured to both participate in on-chain staking (generating rewards) and provide market exposure to token price changes. Staking rewards would be retained or distributed according to each fund‚Äôs prospectus. Issuers emphasize the ability to deliver staking yield without investors directly managing private keys. Why is the SEC review delayed and what are the regulatory implications? The SEC‚Äôs standard review period for ETF filings is approximately 75 days, but reduced staffing from the government shutdown has slowed processing. Past shutdowns, such as in 2018, caused notable approval delays; analysts expect a similar impact now. Any approvals will still need to satisfy custody, custody-provider oversight, and compliance requirements for staking activities. Which tokens and issuers are named in filings? Filings list staked tokens including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI, SUI, TAO and HYPE. The documents reference allocation flexibility allowing up to 40% of fund assets to be invested in non-U.S. exchange-traded products from issuers named in plain text: 21Shares, CoinShares and Valour. Issuers plan Cayman Islands feeder structures to preserve regulated investment company status under U.S. tax rules. How might investor exposure differ compared to existing spot ETFs? Staking crypto ETFs differ from spot ETFs by adding a yield component from protocol-level staking. Investors gain passive yield (subject to slashing and validator performance) in addition to price appreciation or depreciation. The funds aim to reduce operational friction for institutional investors while preserving tradability on U.S. exchanges. Summary comparison of proposed ETFs (example allocation) ETF Primary Token Staking Enabled Potential Non‚ÄëU.S. Allocation Target Investor REX-Osprey ADA Staked ETF ADA Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey AVAX Staked ETF AVAX Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey NEAR Staked ETF NEAR Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional When could decisions resume and what should investors watch? Approvals are likely to resume once full SEC operations return; October 2025 is noted as a key month for several pending crypto ETF deadlines. Investors should monitor SEC notices, prospectus amendments, and custody disclosures for staking mechanics, fee schedules, and counterparty arrangements. Frequently Asked Questions Will staking ETFs increase investor access to altcoins? Yes. Staking ETFs aim to broaden access by allowing investors to gain price and yield exposure through regulated vehicles, avoiding direct custody and staking complexities. Product terms will determine yield distribution and fee impact. Can fund assets be invested in non-U.S. ETPs? Yes. Filings state up to 40% of a fund‚Äôs assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto exchange-traded products from issuers referenced in the filings. This may diversify access to European and Canadian markets within a U.S.-listed wrapper. Are staking rewards guaranteed? No. Staking rewards depend on network conditions, validator performance and protocol rules. Rewards can fluctuate and may be subject to penalties such as slashing for misbehavior or downtime. Key Takeaways Regulatory review active : The SEC is reviewing 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETF filings; approval timelines are delayed by a government shutdown. Yield + market exposure : Proposed ETFs combine staking rewards with token price exposure for altcoins like ADA, AVAX and NEAR. Cross-border allocation : Up to 40% non-U.S. ETP allocation may link funds to international issuers while using Cayman subsidiaries for tax and regulatory alignment. Conclusion The SEC‚Äôs review of staking crypto ETFs from REX and Osprey could expand regulated yield-bearing access to major altcoins, but approval timing remains uncertain due to the government shutdown. ADAUSD.title: Defiance Files for 49 Proposed 3x Leveraged ETFs That Could Include Bitcoin-Focused Funds
ADAUSD.body: Defiance Investments filed a prospectus proposing 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs, including crypto-focused funds that track Coinbase, MicroStrategy, Robinhood, BitMine Immersion, Circle, Grayscale mini-trusts and a Solana ETF; the filing warns these 3X leveraged ETFs carry high short-term risk for aggressive traders. 49 proposed funds offering 3X long and inverse exposure Proposals include crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs, tech stocks and gold with explicit investor risk warnings. Spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF demand helped spur filings; BTC ETFs hold roughly $150 billion in assets (CoinGlass data). 3X leveraged ETFs by Defiance Investments propose triple-long and inverse crypto and tech exposure; read the filing highlights and risk considerations ‚Äî learn more now. What are Defiance Investments‚Äô proposed 3X leveraged ETFs? Defiance Investments‚Äô prospectus requests 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs , offering triple daily exposure to crypto firms, token-linked ETFs and select tech names. The filing lists single-stock, ETF and crypto ETP targets and repeatedly warns these funds are suited only for aggressive, short-term traders. How do the proposed 3X leveraged crypto ETFs differ from existing 2X products? Three-times leveraged ETFs aim to deliver approximately 3X the daily return of an underlying asset, versus 2X funds that seek double daily moves. Because leverage compounds daily, 3X funds amplify volatility and path dependency, increasing the chance of significant losses over multi-day holding periods. Regulators and market analysts have expressed caution. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "headline": "Defiance files for 49 3X leveraged ETFs, including crypto and tech exposures", "datePublished": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "dateModified": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "author": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG" }, "publisher": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG", "logo": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://en.coinotag.com/logo.png" } }, "description": "Defiance Investments proposed 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs covering crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs and tech names, with explicit risk disclosures for short-term traders.", "mainEntityOfPage": { "@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://en.coinotag.com/articles/defiance-49-3x-etfs-prospectus" }} Why did Defiance target crypto firms and token ETFs with 3X leverage? The surge in spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF inflows ‚Äî with Bitcoin-related funds commanding sizable assets according to CoinGlass ‚Äî encouraged issuers to explore leveraged versions despite higher risk. What specific companies and token ETFs are named in the filing? The prospectus lists funds tied to Coinbase, MicroStrategy (Bitcoin treasury exposure), Robinhood, BitMine Immersion (Ethereum treasury exposure), Circle (USDC issuer), Grayscale mini-trust ETFs tracking Bitcoin and Ethereum, and a Solana ETF from Volatility Shares. The filing proposes both 3X long and 3X inverse share classes for many of these exposures. ADAUSD.title: Here‚Äôs What XRP Market Cap Multiplier Effect Means
ADAUSD.body: Every crypto bull market has its buzzwords, but few have sparked as much curiosity among XRP holders as the so-called ‚Äúmarket cap multiplier effect.‚Äù It‚Äôs the idea that XRP‚Äôs true price potential isn‚Äôt limited by its large total supply ‚Äî because only a fraction of that supply is actively available on the market. In other words, XRP‚Äôs liquidity reality may be far smaller than its theoretical supply, meaning smaller inflows of capital could trigger disproportionately large price reactions. Understanding the Market Cap Multiplier In a recent video, Jake Claver, managing partner at Digital Wealth Partners, tackled the growing debate head-on: ‚ÄúPeople look at total supply of XRP when, in reality, the supply-demand dynamics are going to be on the available supply of XRP,‚Äù he explained. This distinction ‚Äî between XRP‚Äôs total supply of 100 billion and the much smaller circulating amount that actually trades ‚Äî is at the heart of the multiplier effect. Let's look at what the XRP market cap multiplier effect means pic.twitter.com/5tiUdpHt6i ‚Äî Jake Claver, QFOP (@beyond_broke) October 3, 2025 Claver illustrated this with a practical example: ‚ÄúThere might be 2 billion XRP left on exchanges ‚Äî probably less than that if you include retail and what they‚Äôre going to exit or sell.‚Äù He added that even if XRP‚Äôs price skyrockets to $10, $20, or even $50, some retail investors would inevitably sell portions of their holdings, adding perhaps another billion XRP to the liquid market. But that still represents a small share of total supply. The Math Behind the Multiplier Claver broke down the logic simply: ‚ÄúIf you only had, let‚Äôs say, 2 billion [XRP] out of 100 billion, you‚Äôd be that 50x that Zach Rector talks about. It‚Äôs total supply versus available supply ‚Äî and that‚Äôs why you get a shift in how much liquidity moving in is going to cause the market cap to rise in a multiplier effect.‚Äù When buyers enter the market, their demand impacts a smaller pool of available tokens, rather than the total supply. This limited float magnifies price movements, which in turn amplifies market capitalization faster than would occur in a fully distributed asset. Institutional Holdings and Market Liquidity Claver also revealed that his firm, Digital Wealth Partners, currently manages around 200 million XRP, accounting for roughly 8% of retail-owned XRP, based on his estimates. This institutional custody further concentrates holdings, reducing the amount of XRP readily available on exchanges. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 ‚ÄúRetail doesn‚Äôt hold more than maybe 1.2 to 2 billion total XRP in my opinion,‚Äù he said, emphasizing that these liquidity dynamics are critical for understanding XRP‚Äôs future price behavior. Broader Context and Implications While the multiplier concept doesn‚Äôt change XRP‚Äôs total supply ‚Äî which remains capped at 100 billion ‚Äî it reframes how market participants should interpret liquidity and price discovery. Ripple‚Äôs monthly escrow releases , typically capped at 1 billion XRP, also control how much new supply enters circulation, keeping active liquidity relatively tight. The takeaway is clear: XRP‚Äôs potential price response is not purely a function of total supply, but of how much XRP is actually tradable. As Claver summarized, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs total supply versus available supply. That‚Äôs the reason there is a multiplier effect.‚Äù The XRP market cap multiplier effect shows how small changes in liquidity can lead to significant price movements. It‚Äôs not speculation ‚Äî it‚Äôs a structural feature of how XRP trades in real-world conditions, where limited availability magnifies every dollar of demand that flows into the asset. SOLUSD.title: SEC May Review REX-Osprey Staking ETFs Offering Solana Yield and Price Exposure Amid Shutdown Delays
SOLUSD.body: REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are exchange-traded funds that combine price exposure with staking rewards, allowing investors to earn yield on tokens such as ADA, AVAX and NEAR while tracking market performance. The SEC is reviewing 21 such ETF filings amid government shutdown delays. SEC review of 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs underway Funds propose staking exposure to altcoins including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SUI and others. Up to 40% of assets may be allocated to non-U.S. crypto ETPs from issuers like 21Shares and CoinShares. Meta description: staking crypto ETFs under SEC review ‚Äî 21 REX-Osprey filings offer yield plus price exposure to ADA, AVAX, NEAR; follow regulatory updates on en.coinotag.com. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs offering yield and price exposure to altcoins like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR amid shutdown delays. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs as shutdown delays approval and review timelines. New ETFs include staked tokens like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR, offering both yield and price exposure. Up to 40% of ETF assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto ETPs from 21Shares, CoinShares, and Valour. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is reviewing multiple staking-based crypto ETF filings while operating with reduced staff during a government shutdown. REX Shares and Osprey Funds have proposed 21 spot ETFs that combine staking rewards with token price exposure, broadening regulated access to altcoins for institutional and retail investors. What are the REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs under SEC review? REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are proposed funds that would hold and stake selected proof-of-stake tokens, paying staking rewards to the ETF while tracking token price movements. The filings name tokens such as ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI and SUI and outline use of Cayman subsidiaries to meet regulatory and tax requirements. How do these ETFs combine yield and price exposure? The funds are structured to both participate in on-chain staking (generating rewards) and provide market exposure to token price changes. Staking rewards would be retained or distributed according to each fund‚Äôs prospectus. Issuers emphasize the ability to deliver staking yield without investors directly managing private keys. Why is the SEC review delayed and what are the regulatory implications? The SEC‚Äôs standard review period for ETF filings is approximately 75 days, but reduced staffing from the government shutdown has slowed processing. Past shutdowns, such as in 2018, caused notable approval delays; analysts expect a similar impact now. Any approvals will still need to satisfy custody, custody-provider oversight, and compliance requirements for staking activities. Which tokens and issuers are named in filings? Filings list staked tokens including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI, SUI, TAO and HYPE. The documents reference allocation flexibility allowing up to 40% of fund assets to be invested in non-U.S. exchange-traded products from issuers named in plain text: 21Shares, CoinShares and Valour. Issuers plan Cayman Islands feeder structures to preserve regulated investment company status under U.S. tax rules. How might investor exposure differ compared to existing spot ETFs? Staking crypto ETFs differ from spot ETFs by adding a yield component from protocol-level staking. Investors gain passive yield (subject to slashing and validator performance) in addition to price appreciation or depreciation. The funds aim to reduce operational friction for institutional investors while preserving tradability on U.S. exchanges. Summary comparison of proposed ETFs (example allocation) ETF Primary Token Staking Enabled Potential Non‚ÄëU.S. Allocation Target Investor REX-Osprey ADA Staked ETF ADA Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey AVAX Staked ETF AVAX Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey NEAR Staked ETF NEAR Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional When could decisions resume and what should investors watch? Approvals are likely to resume once full SEC operations return; October 2025 is noted as a key month for several pending crypto ETF deadlines. Investors should monitor SEC notices, prospectus amendments, and custody disclosures for staking mechanics, fee schedules, and counterparty arrangements. Frequently Asked Questions Will staking ETFs increase investor access to altcoins? Yes. Staking ETFs aim to broaden access by allowing investors to gain price and yield exposure through regulated vehicles, avoiding direct custody and staking complexities. Product terms will determine yield distribution and fee impact. Can fund assets be invested in non-U.S. ETPs? Yes. Filings state up to 40% of a fund‚Äôs assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto exchange-traded products from issuers referenced in the filings. This may diversify access to European and Canadian markets within a U.S.-listed wrapper. Are staking rewards guaranteed? No. Staking rewards depend on network conditions, validator performance and protocol rules. Rewards can fluctuate and may be subject to penalties such as slashing for misbehavior or downtime. Key Takeaways Regulatory review active : The SEC is reviewing 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETF filings; approval timelines are delayed by a government shutdown. Yield + market exposure : Proposed ETFs combine staking rewards with token price exposure for altcoins like ADA, AVAX and NEAR. Cross-border allocation : Up to 40% non-U.S. ETP allocation may link funds to international issuers while using Cayman subsidiaries for tax and regulatory alignment. Conclusion The SEC‚Äôs review of staking crypto ETFs from REX and Osprey could expand regulated yield-bearing access to major altcoins, but approval timing remains uncertain due to the government shutdown. Market participants should track prospectus details and SEC notices on en.coinotag.com for updates and final terms. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "headline": "SEC Reviews 21 REX-Osprey Staking Crypto ETFs ‚Äî Yield and Price Exposure for Altcoins", "description": "REX-Osprey proposes 21 staking crypto ETFs combining staking rewards and token price exposure for ADA, AVAX, NEAR and others; SEC review delayed by government shutdown.", "image": [ "https://en.coinotag.com/assets/images/crypto-etf.jpg" ], "datePublished": "2025-10-04T08:00:00Z", "dateModified": "2025-10-04T08:00:00Z", "author": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG", "url": "https://en.coinotag.com" }, "publisher": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG", "logo": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://en.coinotag.com/assets/images/logo.png" } }, "mainEntityOfPage": { "@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://en.coinotag.com/articles/rex-osprey-staking-etfs" }} { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "FAQPage", "mainEntity": [ { "@type": "Question", "name": "What are REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are proposed funds that stake selected proof-of-stake tokens to generate rewards while providing price exposure to those tokens within a regulated ETF structure." } }, { "@type": "Question", "name": "Why are SEC decisions delayed?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "Decisions are delayed due to a U.S. government shutdown reducing SEC staffing and review capacity, extending the normal 75-day review timeline for ETF filings." } }, { "@type": "Question", "name": "Can fund assets be invested in non-U.S. crypto products?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes. SOLUSD.title: Defiance Files for 49 Proposed 3x Leveraged ETFs That Could Include Bitcoin-Focused Funds
SOLUSD.body: Defiance Investments filed a prospectus proposing 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs, including crypto-focused funds that track Coinbase, MicroStrategy, Robinhood, BitMine Immersion, Circle, Grayscale mini-trusts and a Solana ETF; the filing warns these 3X leveraged ETFs carry high short-term risk for aggressive traders. 49 proposed funds offering 3X long and inverse exposure Proposals include crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs, tech stocks and gold with explicit investor risk warnings. Spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF demand helped spur filings; BTC ETFs hold roughly $150 billion in assets (CoinGlass data). 3X leveraged ETFs by Defiance Investments propose triple-long and inverse crypto and tech exposure; read the filing highlights and risk considerations ‚Äî learn more now. What are Defiance Investments‚Äô proposed 3X leveraged ETFs? Defiance Investments‚Äô prospectus requests 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs , offering triple daily exposure to crypto firms, token-linked ETFs and select tech names. The filing lists single-stock, ETF and crypto ETP targets and repeatedly warns these funds are suited only for aggressive, short-term traders. How do the proposed 3X leveraged crypto ETFs differ from existing 2X products? Three-times leveraged ETFs aim to deliver approximately 3X the daily return of an underlying asset, versus 2X funds that seek double daily moves. Because leverage compounds daily, 3X funds amplify volatility and path dependency, increasing the chance of significant losses over multi-day holding periods. Regulators and market analysts have expressed caution. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "headline": "Defiance files for 49 3X leveraged ETFs, including crypto and tech exposures", "datePublished": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "dateModified": "2025-10-03T00:00:00Z", "author": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG" }, "publisher": { "@type": "Organization", "name": "COINOTAG", "logo": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://en.coinotag.com/logo.png" } }, "description": "Defiance Investments proposed 49 new 3X leveraged and inverse ETFs covering crypto firms, token-tracking ETFs and tech names, with explicit risk disclosures for short-term traders.", "mainEntityOfPage": { "@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://en.coinotag.com/articles/defiance-49-3x-etfs-prospectus" }} Why did Defiance target crypto firms and token ETFs with 3X leverage? Defiance targeted crypto firms and token-linked ETFs to meet rising investor demand for direct and derivative exposure to digital assets. The surge in spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF inflows ‚Äî with Bitcoin-related funds commanding sizable assets according to CoinGlass ‚Äî encouraged issuers to explore leveraged versions despite higher risk. What specific companies and token ETFs are named in the filing? The prospectus lists funds tied to Coinbase, MicroStrategy (Bitcoin treasury exposure), Robinhood, BitMine Immersion (Ethereum treasury exposure), Circle (USDC issuer), Grayscale mini-trust ETFs tracking Bitcoin and Ethereum, and a Solana ETF from Volatility Shares. The filing proposes both 3X long and 3X inverse share classes for many of these exposures. Frequently Asked Questions { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "FAQPage", "mainEntity": [ { "@type": "Question", "name": "Are 3X leveraged ETFs suitable for long-term investing?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "No. 3X leveraged ETFs are designed for short-term trading and can diverge greatly from expected returns over multiple days due to daily compounding and amplified volatility." } }, { "@type": "Question", "name": "What risks did Defiance highlight in its prospectus?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "The prospectus warns that 3X leveraged and inverse funds may not be appropriate for all investors and can result in rapid losses if the underlying asset moves unexpectedly." } }, { "@type": "Question", "name": "Which market data supports interest in crypto ETFs?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "Industry data referenced in coverage shows spot Bitcoin ETFs have amassed significant assets ‚Äî Bitcoin-related funds alone account for roughly $150 billion according to CoinGlass analytics." } } ]} Will the SEC allow more 3X leveraged ETFs? Recent filings ‚Äî including Defiance‚Äôs ‚Äî indicate the SEC is receiving applications for higher-leverage products. Market analysts, such as ETF.com senior analyst Sumit Roy, note the regulator may permit more volatile products, but approvals will depend on disclosures, structure and investor-protection considerations. How should investors evaluate proposed 3X leveraged ETFs? Evaluate leverage objectives, daily rebalancing mechanics, expense ratios, underlying liquidity, and prospectus risk disclosures. Compare historical one-day return replication and understand compounding effects for multi-day holdings. These funds are primarily for experienced, short-term traders. { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "HowTo", "name": "How to evaluate a 3X leveraged ETF", "description": "Steps to assess whether a 3X leveraged ETF aligns with a trader's objectives and risk tolerance.", "step": [ { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Read the prospectus", "text": "Review leverage goal, daily reset rules, and risk warnings contained in the fund's prospectus." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Analyze volatility and liquidity", "text": "Check historical intraday and daily volatility of the underlying asset and the ETF's trading volume." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Simulate multi-day scenarios", "text": "Model multi-day returns to understand compounding effects and potential drawdowns for holding periods beyond one day." }, { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Compare costs", "text": "Compare expense ratios and transaction costs relative to alternative exposure methods." } ]} Key Takeaways Defiance filed for 49 3X ETFs : Proposals include crypto firms, token ETFs and tech stocks, with both long and inverse classes. Higher leverage increases risk : 3X daily leverage amplifies volatility and can produce large multi-day divergences from expected returns. Investor due diligence required : Read prospectuses, assess liquidity and model compounding before trading these products. Conclusion The Defiance prospectus signals a push to expand 3X leveraged ETFs across crypto and tech exposures, reflecting issuer interest in meeting aggressive trader demand. 3X leveraged ETFs may arrive if approved, but their complexity and high risk make careful evaluation essential. Monitor regulatory decisions and read fund disclosures before trading. NEW: @Defiance_ETFs has just filed for just shy of 50 3X levered ETFs. Some on single stocks, some on other ETFs, some on crypto ETPs. Things are getting wild. ‚Äî James Seyffart (@JSeyff) October 3, 2025 By: COINOTAG ‚Ä¢ Published: 2025-10-03 ‚Ä¢ Updated: 2025-10-03 Sources referenced in reporting: Defiance Investments prospectus filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission; commentary from Bloomberg analyst James Seyffart; data from CoinGlass; analysis quotes from ETF.com senior analyst Sumit Roy.

SOLUSD.title: VanEck Says Lower Volatility May Explain September Network Revenue Drops as Tron Remains Top Earner
SOLUSD.body: Blockchain network revenue fell 16% month-over-month in September as reduced crypto volatility lowered demand for high-priority transactions, driving network fees down across major chains such as Ethereum, Solana and Tron. Network revenue fell 16% MoM in September Ethereum fees down 6%, Solana down 11%, Tron fees dropped 37% after a governance fee cut. Volatility fell sharply: ETH -40%, SOL -16%, BTC -26% ‚Äî reducing arbitrage-driven fee demand. Blockchain network revenue fell 16% in September due to lower crypto volatility; read the full analysis, data, and investor takeaways. Learn how fees and fundamentals changed. Asset manager VanEck attributed the broad decline in blockchain network revenue in September to lower volatility in the crypto markets. What caused the decline in blockchain network revenue in September? Blockchain network revenue declined 16% month-over-month in September primarily because lower crypto volatility reduced traders‚Äô need to pay priority fees, decreasing total fees across major networks. VanEck‚Äôs analysis cites reduced arbitrage and fewer high-priority transactions as the main drivers. VanEck reported that overall network revenues across the blockchain ecosystem dropped by 16% month-over-month in September, linked to diminished volatility and lower transaction fee demand. Ethereum network revenue fell by 6% and Solana‚Äôs by 11%. The Tron network recorded a 37% reduction in fees, which VanEck attributes to a governance proposal that halved gas fees in August. Most cryptocurrencies experienced reduced volatility in September. Source: VanEck How did volatility changes affect crypto network fees? Reduced volatility curtailed arbitrage and time-sensitive trading that typically pushes users to pay higher fees for faster settlement. Ether (ETH) volatility dropped about 40% in September, SOL volatility fell 16%, and BTC volatility declined 26%, according to VanEck‚Äôs figures. Lower volatility means fewer rapid price moves and thus fewer priority transactions, translating directly into lower network revenue and smaller fee pools for validators and miners. Why did Tron lead revenue metrics despite lower fees? Tron remains the top revenue-generating crypto ecosystem, producing roughly $3.6 billion over the last year, according to Token Terminal data cited in market reporting. This leadership stems largely from stablecoin activity ‚Äî 51% of circulating Tether USDt supply is issued on the Tron network. A comparison of crypto network fees over the last year. Source: Token Terminal By comparison, Ethereum generated about $1 billion in annual revenue despite ETH reaching all-time highs in August and a market capitalization near $539 billion ‚Äî roughly 16x TRX‚Äôs market cap of about $32 billion. Stablecoins continue to expand: the stablecoin market cap crossed $292 billion in October 2025, per RWA.XYZ data, reinforcing Tron‚Äôs role in settlement and recurring fee generation. How should investors interpret network revenue and fees? Network revenues and fees are a core metric for assessing blockchain economic activity and protocol health. Monitor fees as a short-term gauge of transaction demand and revenue as a longer-term indicator of platform monetization and product fit. Analysts track fundamentals such as active addresses, transaction value, and fee revenue to evaluate project trajectories and ecosystem resilience. Frequently Asked Questions How large was the month-over-month revenue decline in September? The blockchain ecosystem saw a 16% month-over-month decline in network revenue in September, driven largely by reduced volatility and lower priority-fee transactions. Did any networks buck the trend in September? Tron continued to lead annual revenue generation despite a 37% monthly fee drop, thanks to heavy stablecoin settlement activity and prior fee-structure changes. What role did governance changes play in fee reductions? On Tron, a governance proposal reduced gas fees by over 50% in August, contributing to a 37% drop in network fees in September as reflected in revenue data. { "@context": "https://schema.org", SOLUSD.title: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron
SOLUSD.body: Asset management giant VanEck has published its cryptocurrency market report for September 2025. The report noted that Digital Asset Treasuries (DAT) holdings have reached approximately $135 billion, with institutional investors, in particular, continuing to accumulate and stake ETH. VanEck noted that this creates a dilution risk for investors outside of staking. The report also touched on Ethereum's upcoming Fusaka upgrade in December. This update is expected to reduce Layer-2 rollup costs by increasing blob capacity and improve network efficiency by allowing nodes to perform block validation using probabilistic sampling. According to VanEck's report, 23 of the 35 major tokens closed the month lower. Bitcoin (BTC) rose 5%, while Ethereum (ETH) fell 5%. The overall decline in market volatility has dampened both price action and blockchain revenue, causing stagnation in the sector. According to the report, blockchain revenues fell by 16% month-over-month: Ethereum revenues: -6% Solana revenues: -11% Tron revenues: -37% VanEck stated that the primary reason for this decline was the decrease in market volatility. In September, volatility fell by -40% for ETH, -26% for BTC, and -16% for SOL. While decentralized spot exchange (DEX) volumes remained at August levels of approximately $365 billion, futures volumes increased by 30%. Much of this increase was driven by the token launch of the Aster platform within the Binance ecosystem and incentivized trading pairs. Related News: Claims Spread That XRP Spot ETF Was Automatically Approved: How True Is It? I want to show you exactly what my game plan is, what my expectations are. Is the momentum bullish? Is there a potential bull trap? (urgent) pic.twitter.com/AkTJkXiv6i ‚Äî STEPH IS CRYPTO (@Steph_iscrypto) October 3, 2025 The Key Confirmation Level: $3 Daily Close The analyst stressed that confirmation is essential before calling a full breakout: ‚ÄúFor me to absolutely call and to confirm this breakout, I would need to see the daily candle of today close above three dollars.‚Äù According to Steph, a confirmed daily close above this level would strongly suggest that XRP is ‚Äúmost likely heading a lot higher in the next days and the next weeks.‚Äù He maintained a technical target of around $5 , derived from the height of the bull flag‚Äôs pole, but cautioned traders to remain realistic. ‚ÄúThere are no guarantees on the way up,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMaybe XRP is not going to go to five dollars‚Äîmaybe we‚Äôre going to stop at four dollars or $4.50. It‚Äôs important that you have an exit strategy and that you secure profits on the way up.‚Äù Bullish Momentum Confirmed by EMA Ribbons Steph also highlighted a significant technical signal‚Äîthe EMA ribbons on the daily chart. He noted that XRP is ‚Äúright now actually breaking above daily ribbons, which is a strong sign and shows a lot of bullish momentum, a lot of buying pressure going on.‚Äù Historically, when XRP breaks above these ribbons, it often indicates the start of a larger upward move, especially if accompanied by increasing volume. DOGEUSD.title: Are These the 2 Best Cryptos to Buy as Trump-Backed Thumzup Media Expands Dogecoin Mining With $2.5M Investment?
DOGEUSD.body: Thumzup Media, a Trump-backed company, has announced that it has invested $2.5 million in ramping up Dogecoin mining activities with hundreds of additional ASIC rigs and a significant boost in network hash power. The move has rekindled bullish interest in Dogecoin (DOGE), with some speculating that institutional entry may take its price beyond the $1 mark during the next bull run. That said, though DOGE‚Äôs momentum is worth keeping an eye on, more seasoned investors are now turning their attention to Mutuum Finance (MUTM) with much greater upside potential. Now at only $0.035, Mutuum Finance has already emerged as one of 2025‚Äôs most formidable DeFi plays thanks to its dual lending ecosystem, real-yield tokenomics, and non-custodial smart contract architecture. Presale Stage 6 is already over 55% sold, with more than 16,750 holders and more than $16.8 million raised, all of which are positive indicators of institutional and whale confidence. Mutuum Finance is the smart, utility-backed choice over meme-driven cryptocurrencies like DOGE. Thumzup Media‚Äôs $2.5M Investment Has the Potential to Be a Game-Changer for Dogecoin‚Äôs Future Dogecoin (DOGE) is winning back institutional confidence after Thumzup Media, a Trump family-supported business, made a substantial $2.5 million investment. The funding will enable DogeHash Technologies to expand its mining capacity exponentially, with over 4,000 mining rigs operational prior to year-end, one of the most extensive Dogecoin mining networks in the U.S. The addition of 500 new high-performance ASIC miners will expand the hash rate of the network, accelerating transaction speed, boosting security, and building further trust in the system as a whole. Thumzup‚Äôs entry, signaled by its recent acquisition of 19 BTC and 7.5 million DOGE and eventual investment of as much as $250 million in digital assets, is an indicator of growing institutional interest and confidence in Dogecoin‚Äôs long-term potential. Analysts predict the development to catalyze broader institutional uptake and boost DOGE‚Äôs position in mainstream crypto portfolios. But as Dogecoin fundamentals keep growing stronger, increasingly more investors are also investigating Mutuum Finance (MUTM), which could offer even greater upside potential beyond the meme-coin narrative. Mutuum Finance Presale Gains Traction Mutuum Finance is generating even more hype and anticipation for its presale, with the platform already raising over $16.8 million and having over 16,750 investors onboard to date. Stage 6 of the project is ongoing, during which MUTM tokens are available for purchase at $0.035 per token. In appreciation of early adopters, Mutuum Finance is hosting a $100,000 giveaway promotion, in which 10 users will be rewarded with $10,000 worth of MUTM tokens each. The protocol will have a dynamic floating interest rate mechanism that makes the most efficient use of liquidity. Low interest rate environments and excess liquidity environments encourage borrowing and ecosystem activity and high demand environments and higher interest rates encourage loan repayment and incoming capital flows. Fixed interest models function optimally when liquidity is constant, adjusting organically to overall market forces. Mutuum Finance Advances Development of Lending & Borrowing Protocol Mutuum Finance is going ahead with the development of its lending and borrowing protocol , a key step to enhancing its decentralized finance ecosystem. The first version (V1) of the protocol is expected on Sepolia Testnet in Q4 2025 and will include functionalities such as a liquidity pool, mtToken, debt token, liquidator bot, and more. ETH and USDT will be supported for lending, borrowing, and collateral at the time of launch, providing users with a convenient and secure DeFi experience. Lending, borrowing, and liquidation at a profit require efficient asset valuation. To this effect, Mutuum Finance uses Chainlink oracles to retrieve live USD and principal crypto asset prices such as ETH, MATIC, and AVAX. The platform realizes optimum data accuracy by utilizing fallback oracle systems, composite data feeds, and time-weighted averages from decentralized exchanges for quality valuations during the highly volatile and distressed market conditions. Dogecoin (DOGE) or Mutuum Finance (MUTM)? Dogecoin‚Äôs $2.5M mining incentive shows growing interest, but Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is a far more promising prospect. At $0.035 and with over 55% sold, 16,750+ buyers and $16.8M invested, MUTM‚Äôs twin lending ecosystem, real-yield tokenomics, and upcoming DeFi protocol render it a utility-based altcoin with tremendous growth potential, which makes DOGE seem like a less desirable option for serious investors. DOGEUSD.title: Eric Trump: I Know Brad Garlinghouse and XRP Very Well
DOGEUSD.body: A single podcast moment has sent ripples through both the political and crypto worlds. During a recent appearance on the PBD Podcast, Eric Trump made striking comments about his familiarity with Ripple, XRP, and its CEO, Brad Garlinghouse. The clip, shared by popular crypto influencer JackTheRippler on X, quickly gained momentum ‚Äî fueling widespread discussion about the growing intersection between politics and digital finance. The conversation took place during the October 4, 2025, episode of the PBD Podcast, hosted by entrepreneur Patrick Bet-David. When asked how he felt about Dogecoin, XRP, Ripple, and Ethereum, Eric Trump‚Äôs candid response caught the attention of the crypto community. ‚ÄúI know them all extremely well. I know Brad very well, and XRP, he‚Äôs done a great job,‚Äù Trump said. JackTheRippler‚Äôs post featuring the clip has since gone viral, with thousands of reposts and comments from the XRP community. Many enthusiasts see Trump‚Äôs acknowledgment of Garlinghouse as a symbolic nod to Ripple‚Äôs growing relevance in global finance ‚Äî especially as the company continues to recover from years of legal scrutiny and reposition itself for mainstream adoption. Eric Trump says that he knows Brad Garlinghouse and #XRP very well! pic.twitter.com/EK4bygBRLh ‚Äî JackTheRippler ¬© (@RippleXrpie) October 4, 2025 A Notable Moment for Ripple and XRP Ripple‚Äôs reputation has strengthened considerably in 2025 following the conclusion of its legal dispute with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Ripple has focused on scaling its payment infrastructure and expanding the reach of RLUSD. In this context, Eric Trump‚Äôs praise for Brad Garlinghouse carries additional weight. His words come at a time when institutional interest in blockchain payment systems is accelerating ‚Äî and when the U.S. political landscape is increasingly open to discussing crypto innovation within regulated frameworks. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Bridging Politics and Crypto Innovation Eric Trump‚Äôs remarks also highlight a broader trend: the mainstreaming of cryptocurrency within political and economic circles. His characterization of Bitcoin as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù and Ethereum as ‚Äúfinancial oil‚Äù reflects an informed understanding of their roles within the digital economy. Yet, it was his personal acknowledgment of Brad Garlinghouse and XRP that truly resonated with investors, given Ripple‚Äôs established presence in institutional payment settlements. The moment signifies how figures within political leadership are beginning to publicly recognize the companies driving blockchain utility, not just speculative assets. In conclusion, while Eric Trump did not make any investment claims about XRP, his recognition of Brad Garlinghouse and Ripple stands as a noteworthy endorsement from a prominent political figure. The viral clip shared by JackTheRippler underscores how quickly influence, politics, and crypto narratives can converge ‚Äî sometimes in just a few seconds of conversation. For Ripple and its supporters, those few words from the president‚Äôs son may have done more than spark social-media buzz; they reaffirmed that XRP‚Äôs name is now part of the mainstream financial dialogue. DOTUSD.title: SEC May Review REX-Osprey Staking ETFs Offering Solana Yield and Price Exposure Amid Shutdown Delays
DOTUSD.body: REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are exchange-traded funds that combine price exposure with staking rewards, allowing investors to earn yield on tokens such as ADA, AVAX and NEAR while tracking market performance. The SEC is reviewing 21 such ETF filings amid government shutdown delays. SEC review of 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs underway Funds propose staking exposure to altcoins including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SUI and others. Up to 40% of assets may be allocated to non-U.S. crypto ETPs from issuers like 21Shares and CoinShares. Meta description: staking crypto ETFs under SEC review ‚Äî 21 REX-Osprey filings offer yield plus price exposure to ADA, AVAX, NEAR; follow regulatory updates on en.coinotag.com. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs offering yield and price exposure to altcoins like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR amid shutdown delays. SEC reviews 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs as shutdown delays approval and review timelines. New ETFs include staked tokens like ADA, AVAX, and NEAR, offering both yield and price exposure. Up to 40% of ETF assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto ETPs from 21Shares, CoinShares, and Valour. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is reviewing multiple staking-based crypto ETF filings while operating with reduced staff during a government shutdown. REX Shares and Osprey Funds have proposed 21 spot ETFs that combine staking rewards with token price exposure, broadening regulated access to altcoins for institutional and retail investors. What are the REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs under SEC review? REX-Osprey staking crypto ETFs are proposed funds that would hold and stake selected proof-of-stake tokens, paying staking rewards to the ETF while tracking token price movements. The filings name tokens such as ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI and SUI and outline use of Cayman subsidiaries to meet regulatory and tax requirements. How do these ETFs combine yield and price exposure? The funds are structured to both participate in on-chain staking (generating rewards) and provide market exposure to token price changes. Staking rewards would be retained or distributed according to each fund‚Äôs prospectus. Issuers emphasize the ability to deliver staking yield without investors directly managing private keys. Why is the SEC review delayed and what are the regulatory implications? The SEC‚Äôs standard review period for ETF filings is approximately 75 days, but reduced staffing from the government shutdown has slowed processing. Past shutdowns, such as in 2018, caused notable approval delays; analysts expect a similar impact now. Any approvals will still need to satisfy custody, custody-provider oversight, and compliance requirements for staking activities. Which tokens and issuers are named in filings? Filings list staked tokens including ADA, AVAX, DOT, NEAR, SEI, SUI, TAO and HYPE. The documents reference allocation flexibility allowing up to 40% of fund assets to be invested in non-U.S. exchange-traded products from issuers named in plain text: 21Shares, CoinShares and Valour. Issuers plan Cayman Islands feeder structures to preserve regulated investment company status under U.S. tax rules. How might investor exposure differ compared to existing spot ETFs? Staking crypto ETFs differ from spot ETFs by adding a yield component from protocol-level staking. Investors gain passive yield (subject to slashing and validator performance) in addition to price appreciation or depreciation. The funds aim to reduce operational friction for institutional investors while preserving tradability on U.S. exchanges. Summary comparison of proposed ETFs (example allocation) ETF Primary Token Staking Enabled Potential Non‚ÄëU.S. Allocation Target Investor REX-Osprey ADA Staked ETF ADA Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey AVAX Staked ETF AVAX Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional REX-Osprey NEAR Staked ETF NEAR Yes Up to 40% Retail & Institutional When could decisions resume and what should investors watch? Approvals are likely to resume once full SEC operations return; October 2025 is noted as a key month for several pending crypto ETF deadlines. Investors should monitor SEC notices, prospectus amendments, and custody disclosures for staking mechanics, fee schedules, and counterparty arrangements. Frequently Asked Questions Will staking ETFs increase investor access to altcoins? Yes. Staking ETFs aim to broaden access by allowing investors to gain price and yield exposure through regulated vehicles, avoiding direct custody and staking complexities. Product terms will determine yield distribution and fee impact. Can fund assets be invested in non-U.S. ETPs? Yes. Filings state up to 40% of a fund‚Äôs assets may be invested in non-U.S. crypto exchange-traded products from issuers referenced in the filings. This may diversify access to European and Canadian markets within a U.S.-listed wrapper. Are staking rewards guaranteed? No. Staking rewards depend on network conditions, validator performance and protocol rules. Rewards can fluctuate and may be subject to penalties such as slashing for misbehavior or downtime. Key Takeaways Regulatory review active : The SEC is reviewing 21 REX-Osprey staking crypto ETF filings; approval timelines are delayed by a government shutdown. Yield + market exposure : Proposed ETFs combine staking rewards with token price exposure for altcoins like ADA, AVAX and NEAR. Cross-border allocation : Up to 40% non-U.S. ETP allocation may link funds to international issuers while using Cayman subsidiaries for tax and regulatory alignment. Conclusion The SEC‚Äôs review of staking crypto ETFs from REX and Osprey could expand regulated yield-bearing access to major altcoins, but approval timing remains uncertain due to the government shutdown. DOTUSD.title: U.S. tech giants reached $20.8 trillion market cap, surpassing the EU‚Äôs $19.4 trillion GDP milestone
DOTUSD.body: The Magnificent 7 collectively reached a combined market capitalization of $20.8 trillion, surpassing the EU‚Äôs GDP of $19.4 trillion. The GDP of the European Union stood at USD 19.42 trillion in 2024 and was expected to increase slightly to over USD 19.65 trillion in 2025. The European Commission revealed that the spring forecast projected real GDP growth in 2025 at 1.1% in the EU and 0.9% in the euro area, broadly the same rates attained in 2024 Magnificent 7 dominate global markets Nvidia reported a market valuation of $4.3 trillion, $165.2 billion in trailing twelve-month revenue, and $115.4 billion in gross profit. Microsoft reported a market valuation of $3.85 trillion. In the fourth quarter of FY2025, Microsoft‚Äôs sales totalled $76.4 billion, representing an 18% increase over the previous year. Net income increased 24% to $27.2 billion, while operating income increased 23% to $34.3 billion. At $3.65, diluted earnings per share represented a 24% increase over the previous year. As of October 2, Apple had a market value of $3.78 trillion, bolstered by $190.7 billion in gross profit and $408.6 billion in trailing twelve-month revenue, which yielded an annualized return of 17.52% over the past five years. Google‚Äôs Alphabet had a market valuation of $2.95 trillion, $371.4 billion in revenue, and $218.9 billion in gross profit, yielding a five-year annualized return of 27.07%. Amazon had a market valuation of $2.34 trillion, $670.0 billion in revenue, and $332.4 billion in gross profit. Amazon has a 6.39% five-year return. Meta also reported a market valuation of $1.84 trillion, $178.8 billion in revenue, and $146.5 billion in gross profit, yielding a five-year annualized return of 22.61%. As of October 2, Tesla‚Äôs market value stood at $1.48 trillion, bolstered by $16.2 billion in gross profit and $92.7 billion in trailing twelve-month revenue, with a five-year annualized return of 24.38%. Global leaders warn as tech giants drive valuations beyond fundamentals üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏ Over 50% of the US market cap is now pure Tech. Defensives have collapsed to under 15%. This isn‚Äôt diversification ‚Äì it‚Äôs a Tech Empire üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏ $tsla $nvda $google $appl #Bitcoin $qqq pic.twitter.com/taa4SxxSME ‚Äî Hod | Code2Capital (@HodTzdaka) October 3, 2025 David Solomon, CEO of Goldman Sachs, warned on Friday at Italian Tech Week in Turin, that an AI investment frenzy may be overdone and that stock markets are due for a ‚Äúdrawdown.‚Äù Solomon said major US stock indexes have notched record high after record high this year on the promise of artificial intelligence. He argued that there‚Äôs a good chance that not all of those investments will deliver big returns. He noted that the internet craze of the late 1990s and early 2000s drew a frenzy of investment in tech companies at the time. Solomon reminded the crowd that the internet craze was followed by a dramatic collapse, which is commonly known as the ‚Äúdot-com bubble‚Äù. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if in the next 12 to 24 months, we see a drawdown with respect to equity markets.‚Äù David Solomon , Goldman Sachs CEO Jeff Bezos referred to the AI investment wave as an ‚Äúindustrial bubble.‚Äù He also emphasized that innovation stemming from such AI investment cycles can still yield long-term advantages. According to Bezos, the market is seeking the next big breakthrough, reminiscent of the dynamics of previous bubbles. He added that the previous bubble dynamic is why many small AI ventures with weak foundations receive investment. On October 3, Dario Perkins, TS Lombard‚Äôs Managing Director of Global Macro Research, raised an alarm when he noticed that big tech companies were increasingly using off-balance-sheet loans and special purpose entities (SPVs) to finance AI equipment. According to Perkins, this is a ‚Äúrecognition that this is getting out of hand.‚Äù Perkins emphasized that the real leverage and risk exposure of businesses like Meta, which has requested $29 billion in private finance for the expansion of its AI data centre, are concealed by such borrowing techniques. If you're reading this, you‚Äôre already ahead. Stay there with our newsletter .

DOTUSD.title: Analyst: XRP Is on the Brink of Its Parabolic Run. Here‚Äôs the Timeline
DOTUSD.body: Markets have a way of testing conviction before rewarding it. For XRP holders, that moment of quiet before the storm feels closer than ever. After months of sideways consolidation and growing impatience, many analysts now believe XRP is positioning itself for a powerful move ‚Äî one that could redefine its market trajectory when it finally unfolds. The Setup: Pattern and Price Renowned market observer The Crypto Philosopher recently shared a striking technical comparison between XRP‚Äôs current structure and Amazon‚Äôs chart from the early 2000s. In the video, XRP‚Äôs weekly chart is overlaid with Amazon‚Äôs long-term base that preceded its historic 14x rally from $5 to $70. The resemblance, he argues, is no coincidence. A cup-and-handle pattern is emerging in XRP‚Äôs chart, a classic bullish setup that typically precedes a significant upward move. According to The Crypto Philosopher, XRP‚Äôs current support sits firmly around $2.70, with a critical breakout level near $3.02. A confirmed move above this resistance, especially with increasing trading volume, could ignite a parabolic run ‚Äî mirroring the way Amazon‚Äôs breakout unleashed years of compounding gains. Xrp is on the brink of its parabolic run It‚Äôll happen when you least expect it Just keep waiting pic.twitter.com/laTpiG5nzE ‚Äî The Crypto Philosopher (@TheCryptoP73649) October 2, 2025 The Amazon Analogy and Its Implications The comparison to Amazon is notable because it suggests XRP is following a similar pattern of accumulation before explosive growth. Just as Amazon built a foundation for years after the dot-com crash, XRP has been laying groundwork despite market doubts and regulatory challenges. While parallels between equities and digital assets should be drawn with caution, the core logic remains: strong fundamentals, persistent development, and an extended consolidation phase can set the stage for substantial upward revaluation. In XRP‚Äôs case, the alignment of technical structure, liquidity positioning, and renewed investor sentiment strengthens the bullish argument. The Expected Timeline If the pattern continues to unfold as projected, XRP could be entering the final stretch of its handle formation, a period that typically lasts from several days to a few weeks before a breakout confirmation. Analysts suggest that a decisive close above $3.02 would mark the official start of the next leg up. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 From there, momentum could accelerate rapidly, driven by institutional inflows, renewed market confidence, and increased adoption of Ripple‚Äôs technologies in real-world payments and tokenization. However, timing remains fluid. True parabolic runs rarely announce themselves in advance. As The Crypto Philosopher aptly noted, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll happen when you least expect it.‚Äù Risks and Confirmation Signals Despite the bullish outlook, traders are urged to remain disciplined. False breakouts can occur, especially in a volatile market. To confirm the trend, analysts suggest looking for three key indicators: sustained volume growth, successful retests of new support levels, and overall crypto market strength driven by Bitcoin. In summary, XRP‚Äôs technical setup is nearing a crucial inflection point. If price and volume converge as anticipated, the conditions for a parabolic surge could soon align ‚Äî turning patience into payoff for long-term believers. Yet, as every seasoned trader knows, conviction must be matched with caution, because even the most promising charts demand validation before the real run begins. MATICUSD.title: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron
MATICUSD.body: Asset management giant VanEck has published its cryptocurrency market report for September 2025. The report noted that Digital Asset Treasuries (DAT) holdings have reached approximately $135 billion, with institutional investors, in particular, continuing to accumulate and stake ETH. VanEck noted that this creates a dilution risk for investors outside of staking. The report also touched on Ethereum's upcoming Fusaka upgrade in December. This update is expected to reduce Layer-2 rollup costs by increasing blob capacity and improve network efficiency by allowing nodes to perform block validation using probabilistic sampling. According to VanEck's report, 23 of the 35 major tokens closed the month lower. Bitcoin (BTC) rose 5%, while Ethereum (ETH) fell 5%. The overall decline in market volatility has dampened both price action and blockchain revenue, causing stagnation in the sector. According to the report, blockchain revenues fell by 16% month-over-month: Ethereum revenues: -6% Solana revenues: -11% Tron revenues: -37% VanEck stated that the primary reason for this decline was the decrease in market volatility. In September, volatility fell by -40% for ETH, -26% for BTC, and -16% for SOL. While decentralized spot exchange (DEX) volumes remained at August levels of approximately $365 billion, futures volumes increased by 30%. Much of this increase was driven by the token launch of the Aster platform within the Binance ecosystem and incentivized trading pairs. Related News: Claims Spread That XRP Spot ETF Was Automatically Approved: How True Is It? Top performing tokens in September: Mantle (MNT): +53% Avalanche (AVAX): +24% Binance Coin (BNB): +16% The weakest performers are: Polygon (POL): -19% Arbitrum (ARB): -17% Toncoin (TON): -14% VanEck noted that since 2016, September has generally been marked by negative returns. On average, Bitcoin loses 3% of its value in September, while Ethereum loses 7%. The year 2025 is no exception to this historical trend. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: VanEck Releases Critical Report Discussing Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Tron
